result.execSummary:
The defendant Keiona Ann Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3

**11-18-14/ Ellen Brostrom**
The Court ordered the JOC corrected to read 157 days of sentence credit
Concurrent with: with any sentence with release to the Day Reporting Center for Mental Health, AODA treatment and job training.  Huber for work as assigned by the HOC.  Court authorizes Electronic Monitoring.
As a convicted felon, defendant may never possess a firearm or body armor and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keiona Ann Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Correction to sentencing credit:  Court orders credit of 152 days time served.
Court vacates the warrant.

Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in court with attorney Cynthia M. Wynn.  Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1 & 3:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any sentence with credit for 32 days time served; with release to the Day Reporting Center for Mental Health, AODA treatment and job training.  Huber privileges for work as assigned by HOC.  Court authorizes electronic monitoring. 

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, during probation in 14CF1082 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for sentencing, in br. 6.  Parties notified.  lms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
